qas.question: What is recommended to help in the diagnosis of asthma?
Why is spirometry so commonly used to diagnose asthma?

answers.text: It is the single best test for asthma

qas.question: What helps support the evidence of asthma?

answers.text: If the FEV1 measured by this technique improves more than 12% following administration of a bronchodilator

qas.question: What substance can skew the results of an asthma test?
What test can tell the difference between asthma and COPD?
What is recommended for the diagnosis of COPD?

plausible_answers.text: It is the single best test

qas.question: Why is spirometry used to diagnose COPD?

plausible_answers.text: If the FEV1 measured by this technique improves more than 12% following administration of a bronchodilator

qas.question: What is used to support a COPD diagnosis?
What can you take that will change the results of a COPD test?
How often should you use a bronchodialator to track how well COPD is controlled?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Spirometry<b5_0/><a0_0/> is recommended to aid in diagnosis and management. <a1_0><b6_0>It is the single best test<b6_0/> for asthma<a1_0/>. <a2_0><b7_0>If the FEV1 measured by this technique improves more than 12% following administration of a bronchodilator<b7_0/><a2_0/> such as salbutamol, this is supportive of the diagnosis. It however may be normal in those with a history of mild asthma, not currently acting up. As <a3_0><b8_0>caffeine<b8_0/><a3_0/> is a bronchodilator in people with asthma, the use of caffeine before a lung function test may interfere with the results. <a4_0>Single-breath diffusing capacity<a4_0/> can help differentiate asthma from COPD. It is reasonable to perform spirometry <b9_0>every one or two years<b9_0/> to follow how well a person's asthma is controlled.
